title: Burritos
description: Number one recipe of a meal 'to-go' for a trip or a picnic.
story: That's what I make when we travel, either by car or plane. Very comfortable to eat outside, delicious even when served cold. Very nourishing yet very moist and juicy. </br></br>A good alternative for a sandwich. </br></br>I make these when we go skiing or hiking or when we travel by plane.
instructions: Sout√© finely chopped onion on some olive oil.
Add chopped bell pepper, cook for 5 minutes.
Add ground beef, break crumbs (if needed) and cook until golden brown.
Disolve beef boulion in 70 ml water and add to beef, cover the pan and let to cook for 20 min.
Remove lid, wait till water evaporates, add ketchup, season with smoked paprika, burrito spice mix, salt and pepper.
When beef is well cooked, add chopped tomatoes to it, stir well, take off the heat.
Leave to cool for several minutes.
Assembling. On a tortilla add some salad leaves, then some beef, sprinkle with grated cheese.
If I'm making these 'to go', I wrap each burrito individually into aluminum foil.
Can be heated before serving, delicious cold as well.
